nars.art

Class AdaptiveResonanceTheory2.Clust

  • java.lang.Object
    • nars.art.AdaptiveResonanceTheory2.Clust
  • Enclosing class:
    AdaptiveResonanceTheory2

    public static class AdaptiveResonanceTheory2.Clust
extends java.lang.Object
    In the structure Clust are stored all the results.
    More specifically: prototypes, fluctuation (error) and sequence of all examples for each prototype

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float fluctuation
      How many examples were re-assign (they are in a different cluster then they were before)
      java.util.ArrayList<DynamicVector<java.lang.Float>> proto
      proto is a set of created prototypes
      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> proto_seq
      proto_seq it is a sequence of sequences (a matrix).

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Clust() 

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • proto

        public java.util.ArrayList<DynamicVector<java.lang.Float>> proto
        proto is a set of created prototypes

      • proto_seq

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> proto_seq
        proto_seq it is a sequence of sequences (a matrix). Where each line represents one prototype and each column in the line represents some example's ID.
        Example:
        1 2 4
        7 3 5

        The first prototype consists of the ID's examples: 1, 2 and 3
        The second cluster consist of the following examples: 7, 3 and 5
        An example with ID 5 is a vector. In fact, it is an input line

      • fluctuation

        public float fluctuation
        How many examples were re-assign (they are in a different cluster then they were before)

      • Clust

        public Clust()
